  • Description: The package was about to be loaded onto a truck but 2 of the bottles were leaking out on to the hazmat package. The hazmat was then placed into a bin and put in the damage hazmat cage for processing. I put the hazmat into a hazmat bag and placed it in a drum in the damage hazmat cage for pick up.

item.title: Report E-2024070773
item.description:
Report E-2024070773

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-03T00:38:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: HERMITAGE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered to be leaking on the linehaul trailer. Investigation revealed that the drum may have been punctured by a protruding nail or screw in the trailer roll door. The puncture was very small and at the top of the drum so only a small amount of material was released. When stationary, the drum was not leaking. The drum was set aside awaiting disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024072206
item.description:
Report X-2024072206

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Assistant at 042 advised that a pair of pallets arrived damaged to the service center. The pallets were leaking from behind shrink wrap and were likely damaged before being handled by ABF. CURA arrived to clean the spill and the cleaning crew advised that the bags appeared to have been pu nctured by forklift blades before being wrapped.

item.title: Report X-2024072217
item.description:
Report X-2024072217

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS SENT UP THE CONVEYER SYSTEM AND WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING AT THE FIRST TENDER IT CAME TO. THE PRODUCT WAS REMOVED FROM THE BELT AND PLACED ON THE PLATFORM - TWO CONTAINERS STILL IN THE BOX AND TWO OUT. A RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED AND THE SPILL WAS CLEANED UP. UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION DISCOVERED UNDECLARED OXIDIZING LIQUID N.O.S.

item.description:
Report X-2024071725

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner content 2 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottles of low temp san 1 x 2.5-gallon plastic bottle of low temp san had a loose cap allowing 0.10 gallon to release from container. package did not have any slotted partition's bags or absorbent was found . Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition.
